TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TextAnchor extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a selection of content that an annotation is anchored to.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TextAnchor is the object type of the returned <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.IAnchorInfo.ResolvedAnchor%2A> if you are using sticky notes and highlights in flow or fixed documents.
TextAnchor is introduced in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](../Topic/.NET%20Framework%20Versions%20and%20Dependencies.md).
## Examples Consider a simple document reader application that has a comments pane. The comments pane might be a list box that displays the text from a list of annotations that are anchored to a document. If the user selects an item in the list box, then the application brings into view the paragraph in the document that the corresponding annotation object is anchored to.
The following example demonstrates how to implement the event handler of such a list box that serves as the comments pane.
[!code-vb[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/flowdocumentannotatedviewer/window1.xaml.vb#handler)] [!code-cs[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer/Window1.xaml.cs#handler)]

Docs.summary: Gets the end position of the text anchor.
Docs.value: The end position of the text anchor.

remarks.format: ## Remarks BoundingEnd is introduced in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](../Topic/.NET%20Framework%20Versions%20and%20Dependencies.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the beginning position of the text anchor.
Docs.value: The beginning position of the text anchor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks BoundingStart is introduced in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](../Topic/.NET%20Framework%20Versions%20and%20Dependencies.md).
## Examples Consider a simple document reader application that has a comments pane. The comments pane might be a list box that displays the text from a list of annotations that are anchored to a document. If the user selects an item in the list box, then the application brings into view the paragraph in the document that the corresponding annotation object is anchored to.
The following example demonstrates how to implement the event handler of such a list box that serves as the comments pane.
[!code-vb[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/flowdocumentannotatedviewer/window1.xaml.vb#handler)] [!code-cs[FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer#Handler](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/FlowDocumentAnnotatedViewer/Window1.xaml.cs#handler)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the text anchor is equal to the specified object.
Docs.returns: if the two instances are equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Equals is introduced in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)] version 3.5. For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](../Topic/.NET%20Framework%20Versions%20and%20Dependencies.md).
